requirement.name: Metadata Interchange
requirement.desc: Interchange of the metadata specified in this document shall be performed in an accurate and predictable manner.

requirement.name: Import Accuracy
requirement.desc: Upon import, an Edit Protocol compliant application shall clearly report any alteration to the composition during the process according to fallback behaviours that are described in this document.

requirement.name: Import Unsupported Metadata
requirement.desc: In the Edit Protocol Import/Export model an application is not required to import, maintain and subsequently export metadata objects from the AAF file that it cannot understand. Applications shall not however replace or represent a subsequent exported file as the originally imported AAF file.

requirement.name: Immutability of Mobs
requirement.desc: An application shall implement the rules regarding immutability of Mobs as described in the AAF Object Specification v1.1. These rules specify how Mobs shall be identified when they are processed by an application. Specifically, conditions are defined in which the identification of the Mob (MobID) must change, and in which the identification of the Mob must not change.

requirement.name: Log Importing Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: The AAF Edit Protocol does not remove the requirement that importing applications shall log fallback behaviour for the benefit of the user as defined in this document.

requirement.name: Non Edit Protocol Objects
requirement.desc: Inclusion of extraneous data (i.e. non-Edit Protocol Objects and/or Dark Metadata) shall not invalidata, obfuscate or change the meaning of the core Edit Protocol data.

requirement.name: Legacy Features
requirement.desc: Support for legacy features is not required for compliance with the AAF Edit Protocol

requirement.name: Application Crash
requirement.desc: An application shall not lock-up, crash or give-up on exporting or importing an AAF file. When an action is likely to take a considerable amount of time, an indication of this should be provided.

requirement.name: Import Fallback
requirement.desc: Where the feature set of an application is insufficient to completely or accurately import the AAF file, an application shall observe the fallback behaviours specified throughout the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Diagnostic Log
requirement.desc: An application shall provide a mechanism to log diagnostic information for each import or export operation. The log may be temporary, but shall be avaliable to an expert user.

requirement.name: Log Details
requirement.desc: Certain fallback behaviours shall be logged, as defined in the AAF Edit Protocol. Wherever appropriate, the diagnostic log should identify the Mob, Track and Position at which the fallback behaviour was required.

requirement.name: Exporting Disallowed Metadata
requirement.desc: Where the feature set of an exporting application supports program metadata that the Edit Protocol specifically disallows (e.g. a program consisting of different audio sample rates which is disallowed in Section 7.3), the application shall not export that metadata to an Edit Protocol AAF file. The omission of any metadata on export in order to comply with the Edit Protocol should be logged.

requirement.name: Export Clip Method
requirement.desc: An application shall export each clip using one of the methods described in Section 6.1 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Import Clip Method
requirement.desc: An application shall import clips that use any of the methods described in Section 6.1 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Import non-Exported Data
requirement.desc: An application that exports file source material is required to gracefully import material that does not contain it; an application that does not export file source material is required to gracefully import material that contains it.

requirement.name: Export Mobs for Entire Derivation Chain
requirement.desc: An exporting application should include and reference the Mobs for the entire derivation chain to the extent that it is aware of it

requirement.name: End of Derivation Chain
requirement.desc: The end of the derivation change (i.e. the original material), to the extent an application is aware of it, shall be specified using a zero-value SourceClip object.

requirement.name: Include CompositionMob or MasterMob
requirement.desc: If a reference is made to a CompositionMob or MasterMob, that Mob shall be included in the AAF file.

requirement.name: Include SourceMob
requirement.desc: If a reference is made to a SourceMob, that Mob should be included in the AAF file.

requirement.name: Include SourceMobs Wherever Possible
requirement.desc: It is highly desirable to include referenced SourceMobs in the AAF file wherever possible. When an exporting application needs to reference a SourceMob that does not exist at the time, ore exists only in an external system, the application may referebce a SourceMob that is not included in the AAF file.

requirement.name: Resolve Reference on Import
requirement.desc: Where a SourceMob is referenced but not included in the AAF file, the importing application shall attempt to resolve the reference to the SourceMobs that it was previously aware of.

requirement.name: Importing Reference Outside of TimelineMobSlot
requirement.desc: Where a CompositionMob uses a SourceClip object to reference a TimelineMobSlot, the importing application shall treat any references beyond the extent of the TimelineMobSlot (before the begining or after the end) as if they had referenced Filler, i.e. present as black picture or silence audio.

requirement.name: Valid Reference Outside of TimelineMobSlot
requirement.desc: Within a Two-Parameter Audio Dissolve effect a CompositionMob may use a SourceClip object to reference a TimelineMobSlot beyond the extent of the TimelineMobSlot (before the begining or after the end).

requirement.name: Search for Source
requirement.desc: For SourceMob references that remain unresolved, the importing application shall search the part of the derivation chain that is avaliable to find a source it may support. If no supported source is found, some placeholder exxence shall be substituted.

requirement.name: Top-level Composition Specification
requirement.desc: A top-level composition shall be specified using a CompositionMob with Mob::UsageCode property equal to Usage_TopLevel. A top-level composition shall not be referenced by another Mob in the AAF file.

requirement.name: Top-level Composition May Reference
requirement.desc: A top-level composition shall only reference the following kinds of material: a lower-level composition, a sub-clip composition, an adjusted-clip composition, a template clip, or a clip.

requirement.name: Top-level Composition Name
requirement.desc: The top-level composition Mob::Name property shall be a valid name identifying the composition. Where multiple compositions are exported, each shall have a different name.

requirement.name: Top-Level Composition Contents
requirement.desc: A top-level composition shall contain one or more timecode tracks and include a Primary timecode track. Timecode tracks shall use the MobSlot::PhysicalTrackNumber property to distinguish their type, as shown in Section 6.3 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Importing Top-Level Composition Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support the required number of top-level compositions, a subset shall be imported into the application. This fallback behaviour shall be logged. The user should be able to select which top-level compositions are imported from a list of this Mob::Names.

requirement.name: Lower_Level Composition Specification
requirement.desc: A lower-level composition shall be specified using a CompositionMob with Mob::UsageCode property equal to Usage_LowerLevel. A lower-level composition shall be referenced by a top-level or lower-level composition in the AAF file.

requirement.name: Lower-level Composition May Reference
requirement.desc: A lower-level composition shall only reference the following kinds of material: a sub-clip composition, an adjusted-clip composition, a template clip, or a clip.

requirement.name: Lower-level Composition Name
requirement.desc: The lower-level composition Mob::Name property shall be a valid name identifying the composition. Where multiple compositions are exported, each shall have a different name.

requirement.name: Importing Lower-level Composition Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support the required depth of references to lower-level compositions, the application shall replace the references to lower-level compositions with equivalent references to clips, i.e. the linkage from the top-level compositions to the clip shall not be lost. This fallback behaviour shall be logged.

requirement.name: Sub-clip Composition Specification
requirement.desc: A sub-clip composition shall be specified using a CompositionMob with Mob::UsageCode property equal to Usage_SubClip.

requirement.name: Sub-clip Legacy Representation
requirement.desc: An alternative representation of a sub-clip composition is prevalent in legacy files. This representation is a CompositionMob with Mob::AppCode property equal to 2. An importing application may treat this as a sub-clip composition. Any other value of Mob::AppCode property in a CompositionMob may be ignored and the CompositionMob treated as a lower-level composition.

requirement.name: Sub-clip Composition May Reference
requirement.desc: A sub-clip composition shall only reference the following kinds of material: an adjusted-clip composition, a template clip, or a clip.

requirement.name: Sub-clip Composition Contents
requirement.desc: Each essence track of a sub-clip composition shall contain exactly one SourceClip.

requirement.name: Sub-clip Composition Identification
requirement.desc: The sub-clip Mob::Name property shall be a valid name identifying the sub-clip.

requirement.name: CompositionMob: Sub-clip Classification
requirement.desc: A CompositionMob with Mob::UsageCode property equal to Usage_SubClip shall be treated as a sub-clip composition.

requirement.name: CompositionMob: Lower-level Classification
requirement.desc: A CompositionMob with Mob::UsageCode property not equal to Usage_SubClip shall have the Mob::UsageCode property retained; however the Mob shall be treated as a lower-level composition.

requirement.name: Classification of Sub-clips Not Meeting Export Restrictions
requirement.desc: A sub-clip composition that does not comply with the restrictions for exporting sub-clips should be treated as a lower-level composition.

requirement.name: Importing Sub-clip Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support sub-clips, the Mob shall be treated as a lower-level composition.

requirement.name: Adjusted-clip Composition Specification
requirement.desc: An adjusted-clip composition shall be specified using a CompositionMob with Mob::UsageCode property equal to Usage_AdjustedClip.

requirement.name: Adjusted-clip Composition Legacy Representation
requirement.desc: An alternative representation of an adjusted-clip composition is prevalent in legacy files. This representation is a MasterMob containing an OperationGroup. An importing application may treat this as an adjusted clip composition.

requirement.name: Adjusted-clip Composition May Reference
requirement.desc: An adjusted-clip composition shall only reference the following kinds of material: a template clip or a clip.

requirement.name: Adjusted-clip Composition Contents
requirement.desc: Each essence track of an adjusted-clip composition shall contain exactly one OperationGroup.

requirement.name: Adjusted-clip Composition Name
requirement.desc: The adjusted-clip Mob::Name property shall be a valid name identifying the adjusted-clip.

requirement.name: Importing Adjusted-clip Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support adjusted-clips, the Mob shall be treated as a lower-level composition.

requirement.name: Template Clip Specification
requirement.desc: A template clip shall be specified using a MasterMob with Mob::UsageCode property equal to Usage_Template.

requirement.name: Template Clip Contents
requirement.desc: Each essence track of a template clip shall contain exactly one SourceClip. The SourceClip shall have zero-value to denote the end of the known derivation chain.

requirement.name: Convert Template Clip to a Clip
requirement.desc: If all the template clip essence tracks are updated to refer to particular sources, then the template clip shall be converted to a clip.

requirement.name: Template Clip Name
requirement.desc: The template clip Mob::Name property shall be a valid name identifying the template clip.

requirement.name: Importing Template Clip Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support template clips, the Mob shall be treated as a clip with some placeholder essence it it. This fallback behaviour shall be logged.

requirement.name: Clip Specification
requirement.desc: A clip shall be specified using a MasterMob with no Mob::UsageCode property.

requirement.name: Clip May Reference
requirement.desc: A clip shall only reference the following kinds of material: a file source, an import source, a tape source, or a film source.

requirement.name: Unique Clip Reference Type
requirement.desc: A MasterMob shall not reference more than one essence track of a particular file source from each time position in the MasterMob.

requirement.name: Clip Name
requirement.desc: The clip Mob::Name property shall be a valid name identifying the clip.

requirement.name: File Source Specification
requirement.desc: A file source shall be specified using a SourceMob with an EssenceDescriptor that is a sub-class of FileDescriptor.

requirement.name: File Source Must Have FileDescriptor::ContainerDefinition
requirement.desc: The essence associated with a file SourceMob shall either be internal to the AAF file in an EssenceData object or external to the AAF file. In either case, the file SourceMob shall have a FileDescriptor::ContainerDefinition property specifying the kind of essence container.

requirement.name: Locator Should be Used for External Essence in File Source
requirement.desc: Where essence is external to the AAF file, the EssenceDescriptor::Locator property should contain a Locator object specifying the location of the essence.

requirement.name: Locator Contents for External Essence in File Source
requirement.desc: The EssenceDescriptor::Locator property should include at least one NetworkLocator that complies with the constrains set out in Section 6.9 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Exporting File Source Containing Relative URIs
requirement.desc: When exporting an AAF file containing relative URIs, the exporting application should also export the target resources.

requirement.name: Include Source Mobs when Exporting File Source
requirement.desc: If a file source has any of the following sources, then those source mobs should be included and referenced by the file source: an import source, a tape source, or a film source.

requirement.name: File Source Must Refernce a Source
requirement.desc: If a file source does not have an import source, a tape source or a film source, then it shall reference and include a recording source.

requirement.name: May Use EssenceData When Importing File Source
requirement.desc: An importing application may use the EssenceData object in the AAF file if it is present or may use the exteral essence located by the NetworkLocator.

requirement.name: Verify File Source URIs on Import
requirement.desc: Importing applications should verify that URIs can be successfully resolved before attempting to use them.

requirement.name: Importing Without Proper File Source Support
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support file sources or the particular file source format or cannot locate the file source essence, it shall search along the source derivation chain to find a source it may suppoprt. If no supported source is found, some placeholder essence shall be substituted.

requirement.name: File Source Essence Cannot be Found When Importing File Source
requirement.desc: If file source importing fails because the importing essence cannot locate the file source essence, the file source MobID and searched paths shall be logged.

requirement.name: Import File Source Read Error Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If file source importing fails because the reading or parsing of the file source essence was unsuccessful, then the application should import as much of the essence as possible and pad any remaining duration with placeholder essence. This fallback shall be logged.

requirement.name: Use of Recording Source
requirement.desc: When no physical source exists for file source material, such as in the case of live recordings, a recording source may be used to represent the source.

requirement.name: Recording Source Specification
requirement.desc: A recording source shall be specified using a SourceMob with a RecordingDescriptor. A recording source is also known as a recording SourceMob.

requirement.name: Recording Source Contents
requirement.desc: Each essence track of a recording source shall contain exactly one SourceClip. The SourceClip shall have zero-value to denote the end of the known derivation chain.

requirement.name: Recording Source Name
requirement.desc: The recording source Mob::Name property shall be a valid name identifying the source, e.g. a name describing a recording session.

requirement.name: Import Source Specification
requirement.desc: An import source shall be specified using a SourceMob with an ImportDescriptor.

requirement.name: Import Source Locator
requirement.desc: The EssenceDescriptor::Locator property shall include at least one NetworkLocator that complies with the constraints set out in Section 6.9 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Include Sources When Importing Import Source
requirement.desc: If an import source has any of the following source, then those source mobs should be included and referenced by the import source: a tape source or a film source.

requirement.name: Importing Without Proper Import Source Support
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support import sources or the particular import source format as determined by inspection of the file or cannot locate the file source essence, it shall search along the source derivation chain to find a source it may support. If no supported source is found, some placeholder essence shall be substituted.

requirement.name: File Source Essence Cannot be Found When Importing Import Source
requirement.desc: If import source importing fails because the importing application cannot locate the file source essence, the file source MobID and searched paths shall be logged.

requirement.name: Import Import Source Read Error Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If import source importing fails because the reading or parsing of the file source essence was unsuccessful, then the application should import as much of the essence as possible and pad any remaining duration with placeholder essence. This fallback shall be logged.

requirement.name: Tape Source Specification
requirement.desc: A tape source shall be specified using a SourceMob with a TapeDescriptor.

requirement.name: Tape Source Name
requirement.desc: The tape source Mob::Name property shall be a valid name identifying the tape name.

requirement.name: Tape Source Timecode Tracks
requirement.desc: Timecode tracks in a tape SourceMob shall use the MobSlot::PhysicalTrackNumber property to distinguish their type, as shown in the table in Section 6.12 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Tape Source with Film Source
requirement.desc: If a tape has a film source, then it should be included and referenced by the tape source.

requirement.name: Importing Tape Source Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support tape sources or the particular tape source, it shall search along the source derivation chain to find a source it may support. If no supported source is found, some placeholder essence shall be substituted.

requirement.name: Film Source Specification
requirement.desc: A film source shall be specified using a SourceMob with a FilmDescriptor.

requirement.name: Film Source Name
requirement.desc: The film source Mob::Name property shall be a valid name identifying the film reel name.

requirement.name: Film Source Edgecodes
requirement.desc: A film SourceMob may contain one or more edgecode tracks. Edgecode tracks shall use the MobSlot::PhysicalTrackNumber property to distinguish their type as shown in Section 6.13 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Import Film Source Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing applcation does not support film sources, it shall search along the source derivation chain to find a source it may support. If no supported source is found, some placeholder essence shall be substituted.

requirement.name: Video Frame Edit Rate for Audio Track
requirement.desc: If an application does not support sample-accurate audio edititng, then it may use video frame edit rates on audio tracks.

requirement.name: Edit Rate Purpose
requirement.desc: The edit rate should indicate the playback speed of the essence.

requirement.name: Edit Rate Value
requirement.desc: The edit rate value shall be equivalent to the values in the table in Section 7.1 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Edit Rate Restrictions
requirement.desc: A rational with a zero or negative numerator or denominator shall not be used as an edit rate value.

requirement.name: Edit Point Position
requirement.desc: An edit point position may be at any edit unit boundary, as defined by the edit rate value.

requirement.name: Acceptable Edit Rate Values
requirement.desc: An importing application shall accept the edit rate values defined in Section 7.1 of the AAF Edit Protocol and the corresponding edit point positions.

requirement.name: Importing Edit Rate Value Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support edit points at the specified position, is shall round the position to the nearest position that can be supported. Any rounding shall avoid introducing gaps where none existed before and minimize changes to the overall duration. This fallback behaviour shall be logged.

requirement.name: Pull Up/Down Specification
requirement.desc: Pull up and pull down shall be specified using a Pulldown object.

requirement.name: Context For Pulldown Use
requirement.desc: A Pulldown may be used in the following contexts: 1. In a TimelineMobSlot of a file SourceMob, where the Pulldown object contains a SourceClip referencing a tape SourceMob; 2. In a TimelineMobSlot of a tape SourceMob, where the Pulldown object contains a SourceClip referencing a film SourceMob; 3. In a TimelineMobSlot of a tape SourceMob, where the Pulldown object contains a SourceClip referenceing a tape SourceMob.

requirement.name: Importing Pulldown Objects
requirement.desc: An importing application shall accept Pulldown objects in the contexts listed above.

requirement.name: Audio Track Rates
requirement.desc: All audio tracks within a file shall have the same edit rate and sample rate.

requirement.name: Video Edit Rates
requirement.desc: The video edit rate shall be less than or equal to the video sample rate.

requirement.name: Essence Track Names
requirement.desc: The MobSlot::Name property shall be a valid name identifying the essence track. Where multiple essence tracks are exported, each shall have a different Name.

requirement.name: Importing Essence Track Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support the required number of essence tracks of a particular kind, a subset shall be imported into the application. This fallback behaviour shall be logged. The user should be able to select which essence tracks are imported from a list of their MobSlot::Names.

requirement.name: Physical Track Number Specification
requirement.desc: The MobSlot::PhysicalTrackNumber property shall be specified for essence MobSlots within the following kinds of Mobs: CompositionMob, MasterMob, recording SourceMob, import SourceMob, tape SourceMob, film SourceMob.

requirement.name: Physical Track Number is Output Channel Number
requirement.desc: In a CompositionMob or MasterMob, PhysicalTrackNumber is the output channel number that the MobSlot should be routed to when played.

requirement.name: Stereo-Pair Audio Tracks
requirement.desc: For audio tracks belonging to a stereo pair, PhysicalTrackNumber=1 shall mean left, PhysicalTrackNumber=2 shall mean right.

requirement.name: Importing PhysicalTrackNumber Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support the specified PhysicalTrackNumber on a track it is importing, then it shall fallback to a track number that can be supported. This fallback shall be logged. The user should be able to control the mapping of the PhysicalTrackNumber values in the AAF file into the application.

requirement.name: Preserve Mark IN/OUT and Most Recent Points
requirement.desc: In some applications, the most recentlyset Mark IN and Mark OUT points that were set by the user on a clip or composition may be preserved. In addition, the position in the clip or composition that was most recently presented may be preserved.

requirement.name: IN, OUT and User Position Point Specification
requirement.desc: The marked IN and OUT points and user position shall be specified using the TimelineMobSlot::MarkIn, TimelineMobSlot::MarkOut and TimelineMobSlot::UserPos optional properties respectively.

requirement.name: Importing Unspecified Mark Points
requirement.desc: An importing application may assume that the mark points also apply to other tracks for which no marks are specified.

requirement.name: Multi-Channel Audio Representation in CompositionMobs and MasterMobs
requirement.desc: Within a CompositionMob or MasterMob, multi-channel audio shall be represented using multiple tracks with mono sound Data Definition. Within a CompositionMob or MasterMob, a multi-channel sound Data Definition shall not be used.

requirement.name: Intended Placement of Audio Tracks
requirement.desc: The intended placement of each audio track when played shall be indicated using the MobSlot::PhysicalTrackNumber property. The Physical Track Number shall be an integer in the range 1 to the total number of audio tracks in the program. Six channel surround tracks shall be numbered in accordance with SMPTE 320M Standard Assignment B (1=Left; 2=Right; 3=Center; 4=Low Frequency Effects; 5=Left Surround; 6=Right Surround).

requirement.name: Multi-Channel Audio Representation in a SourceMob
requirement.desc: Within a SourceMob, multi-channel audio shall be represented in either of the following ways: a single track with a multi-channel sound Data Definition and a single audio EssenceDescriptor object of multiple channels; or multiple tracks with a mono sound Data Definition and a MultipleDescriptor containing the same number of mono audio EssenceDescriptors.

requirement.name: Reference a Single Channel of a Multi-Channel Track
requirement.desc: To reference a single channel of a multi-channel track from a mono track, the SourceReference::ChannelIDs property shall be used with a single element in the array.

requirement.name: Reference Multiple Channels of a Multi-Channel Track
requirement.desc: To reference multiple channels of a multi-channel track from a multi-channel track, the SourceReference::ChannelIDs property shall be used with multiple elements in the array.

requirement.name: Reference Multiple Mono Tracks from a Multi-Channel Track
requirement.desc: To reference multiple mono tracks from a multi-channel track, the SourceReference::MonoSourceSlotIDs shall be used with multiple elements in the array.

requirement.name: Export Requiring Uncommon Codec
requirement.desc: When exporting multi-channel essence as a single file SourceMob where the multi-channel essence requires a codec that is not widely avaliable, the exporting application should also export the individual channels as separate essence and file SourceMobs, linked into the Mob reference chain.

requirement.name: Importing Multi-Channel Audio
requirement.desc: The importing application shall accept multi-channel audio SourceMobs represented in either of the ways described in Section 7.7 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Accept Multi-Channel Audio Properties on SourceMobs
requirement.desc: The application shall accept the SourceReference::ChannelIDs and SourceReference::MonoSourceSlotIDs properties in SourceMobs.

requirement.name: Accept Multi-Channel Properties on MasterMobs
requirement.desc: The application shall accept the SourceReference::ChannelIDs property (with a single element in the array) in a MasterMob.

requirement.name: Importing Multi-Channel Audio Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support multi-channel audio sources or the particular multi-channes audio file source format, it shall search along the source derivation chain to find a source it may support. If no supported source is found, some placeholder essence shall be substituted.

requirement.name: Specification of a Clip with Multiple File Source Choices
requirement.desc: A clip with multiple file source choices shall be specified using an EssenceGroup object in a MasterMob.

requirement.name: Importing EssenceGroup Objects
requirement.desc: An importing application shall support EssenceGroup objects in a MasterMob.

requirement.name: Criteria for Chosing How to Import an Essence Group
requirement.desc: Importing applications should select one of the Choices in the EssenceGroup based upon a defined criterion. The criterion may be any of the following: an application-defined essence type; an application-defined essence quality measure; a user-defined essence type; a user-defined essence quality measure; or a user selection.

requirement.name: Importing EssenceGroup with Unsupported Criteria Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If an importing application cannot support application or user-defined criteria, it shall by default select the first entry in the Choices property.

requirement.name: Importing EssenceGroup with Matching Choice Fallback Behavour
requirement.desc: If an application finds no Choice which matches a defined criterion, it may select an acceptable alternative or substitute placeholder essence. This fallback behaviour shall be logged.

requirement.name: Use Filler for Gaps
requirement.desc: A gap, where the output is unspecified for a defined duration, shall be specified using a Filler object.

requirement.name: Importing Filler Objects
requirement.desc: An importing application shall accept Filler objects. If Filler is played, it shall be presented as a black picture and silent audio.

requirement.name: Edgecode Specification
requirement.desc: A track of edgecode shall be specified using one or more Edgecode objects.

requirement.name: Timecode Specification
requirement.desc: A track of timecode shall be specified using one or more Timecode objects or a TimecodeStream12M object.

requirement.name: Discontinuity in Edgecode or Timecode
requirement.desc: To specify a discontinuity in edgecode ore timecode, multiple Edgecode objects or Timecode objects shall be placed in a Sequence - the discontinuity occurs at the junction between Edgecode objects or Timecode objects.

requirement.name: Primary Timecode Track
requirement.desc: A Primary timecode track (see Section 6.3 of the AAF Edit Protocol) in a top-level or lower-level composition shall consist of a single Timecode object.

requirement.name: Importing Timecodes and Edgecodes
requirement.desc: An importing application shall accept Edgecode, Timecode and TimecodeStream12M objects and shall support discontinuities in Timecode objects and Edgecode objects within SourceMobs.

requirement.name: Composition Mixdown Clip Specification
requirement.desc: A composition mixdown clip shall be specified as a clip (as specified in Section 6.8 of the AAF Edit Protocol) referencing file sources (as specified in Section 6.9 of the AAF Edit Protocol).

requirement.name: Use of Auxiliary Files
requirement.desc: In some applications, a user may need to reference and embed auxiliary files within an AAF Edit Protocol file.

requirement.name: Specification of Auxiliary Data
requirement.desc: Each auxiliary file EssenceData object shall be specified using a SourceMob with an AuxiliaryDescriptor.

requirement.name: Auxiliary SourceMob Contents
requirement.desc: An auxiliary SourceMob shall contain at least one Slot, which may be a TimelineMobSlot, EventMobSlot or StaticMobSlot as appropriate. The Data Definition of the Segment within the Slot shall be DataDef_Auxiliary.

requirement.name: Referencing Auxiliary SourceMobs
requirement.desc: An AAF Mob (such as an AAF composition) may reference an auxiliary SourceMob using a SourceReference (or sub-class thereof) from a DataDef_Auxiliary Slot in the referencing Mob to the DataDef_Auxiliary Slot in the auxiliary SourceMob.

requirement.name: Specifying Embedded Auxiliary File
requirement.desc: An embedded auxiliary file shall be specified using an EssenceData object containing the auxiliary file data. The EssenceData object is linked to the auxiliary SourceMob using a common MobID.

requirement.name: Importing Auxiliary Data
requirement.desc: The importing application may attempt to recognize the type of auxiliary data from the MIME type in the AuxiliaryDescriptor.

requirement.name: Importing Auxiliary Data Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support auxiliary data file references, or does not support the particular MIME type of auxiliary data file, then the auxiliary Slots may be ignored.

requirement.name: Standard MIDI Files
requirement.desc: A standard MIDI file may be referenced from a composition and embedded in an AAF file as an auxiliary file, as described in Section 9 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: MIDI Reference Limit
requirement.desc: No more than one MIDI auxiliary file shall be referenced from a given composition.

requirement.name: MIDI Type
requirement.desc: A referenced MIDI file shall conform to the standard MIDI specification version 1.

requirement.name: MIDI Mime Type
requirement.desc: The AuxiliaryDescriptor::MimeType property for a referenced MIDI file shall be "audio/midi".

requirement.name: Importing MIDI Files
requirement.desc: The importing application shall parse the MIDI file, including tempo maps, to determine synchronization at further points in the composition.

requirement.name: Annotation Representation
requirement.desc: Annotations may be represented using arrays of TaggedValues or KLVData in the following optional properties: Mob::UserComments, Mob::Attributes, Mob::KLVData, Component::UserComments, Component::Attributes, or Component:: KLVData.

requirement.name: Use of Component::UserComments
requirement.desc: Component::UserComments shall only be used on: the Segment of a MobSlot or a CommentMarker (or its subclasses).

requirement.name: Non-Essence Tracks Containing Annotations
requirement.desc: The Data Definition for non-essence tracks containing annotations shall be DataDef_DescriptiveMetadata.

requirement.name: Use of CommentMarkers for Annotations
requirement.desc: CommentMarkers may be used for annotations that are not associated with a specific essence track; otherwise DescriptiveMarkers (or its subclasses) shall be used.

requirement.name: Comment Marker Placement
requirement.desc: CommentMarkers shall be placed only in EventMobSlots.

requirement.name: Documenting TaggedValues
requirement.desc: Exporting applications shall document all TaggedValues in use using TaggedValueDefinition objects in the Dictionary::TaggedValueDefinitions property.

requirement.name: Documenting KLVData
requirement.desc: Exporting applications shall document all KLVData in use in KLVDataDefinition objects in the Dictionary::KLVDefinitions property.

requirement.name: Importing TaggedValues and KLVData
requirement.desc: The importing application shall preserve declared TaggedValues and declared KLVData in the following properties for later export: Mob::UserComments, Mob::Attributes, Mob::KLVData, Component::UserComments, Component::Attributes, Component::KLVData.

requirement.name: Importing TaggedValues or KLVData
requirement.desc: It is optional for the importing application to preserve any TaggedValues or KLVData items not listed in section 10.1.1 of the AAF Edit Protocol which might be present in imported files.

requirement.name: Importing Metadata
requirement.desc: An importing application may preserve metadata not listed in Section 10.1.1 of the AAF Edit Protocol in accordance with the precepts.

requirement.name: Importing Legacy Annotations
requirement.desc: Importing applications should be aware that legacy files might contain CommentMarkers in tracks with unexpected DataDefinitions such as DataDef_LegacyPicture or DataDef_LegacySound or others. The importing application may freely convert such DataDefinitions to DataDef_DescriptiveMetadata.

requirement.name: Importing Annotation Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If an importing application cannot support particular properties of a DescriptiveMarker, it shall ignore them. This fallback behaviour shall be logged.

requirement.name: Export Support for DescriptiveMarker Class
requirement.desc: The Edit Protocol requires exporting applications to support the DescriptiveMarker class, including the DescriptiveMarker::Description property.

requirement.name: Import/Export Support for MXF DMS-1 Metadata
requirement.desc: The Edit Protocol does not require either exporting or importing applications to explicitly support MXF DMS-1 metadata.

requirement.name: Effect Definitions
requirement.desc: All effects in an AAF file shall be defined with OperationDefinition and ParameterDefinition objects in the Dictionary.

requirement.name: Definition Object Name
requirement.desc: The DefinitionObject::Name property of all DefinitionObjects in the Dictionary shall be a valid, meaningful name.

requirement.name: OperationDefinition Data Definition Value
requirement.desc: An OperationDefinition object in an AAF file shall have a data definition value consistent with the data definition of an OperationGroup object that references it.

requirement.name: Effect Data Definition Values
requirement.desc: The effects defined in the Edit Protocol should be used with the AAF v1.1 data definition values of DataDef_Picture and DataDef_Sound. The deprecated data definition values of DataDef_LegacyPicture and DataDef_LegacySound should only be used when working with legacy AAF v1.0 files.

requirement.name: Importing Effect Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If an importing application does not support an effect or parameter, it may be ignored. This fallback behaviour shall be logged, including the DefinitionObject::Name and DefinitionObject::Description (if present) of the unsupported effect or parameter, to provide the user with an indication of the intended effect.

requirement.name: Effect Invokation Method
requirement.desc: An effect shall be invoked using an OperationGroup object.

requirement.name: Effect Invokation Construction
requirement.desc: Effects shall be invoked using the simplest construction of objects for a given scenario following the precepts of Section 4.2.1 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Transition Effect Containment
requirement.desc: The OperationGroup shall be contained in a Transition object between two Segments.

requirement.name: OperationGroup Containment
requirement.desc: The OperationGroup shall not be contained in a Transition object.

requirement.name: Multiple Effects Sharing Common Material
requirement.desc: Multiple effects sharing common material shall be constructed within a NestedScope object. A continuous section of common material, used by severak effects, shall be represented as a single segment in the NestedScope.

requirement.name: Invoking Effects on Multiple Layers
requirement.desc: Effects on multiple layers shall be constructed within a NestedScope object. The layers shall be ordered background to foreground within the Slots of the NestedScope.

requirement.name: Importing Effects on Multiple Layers Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support the required number of layers, a subset shall be imported into the application. This fallback behaviour shall be logged. The user should be able to select which layers are imported.

requirement.name: Nested Track Specification
requirement.desc: A nested group of tracks within a Segment of a CompositionMob shall be specified using a NestedScope object.

requirement.name: ScopeReference Behaviour
requirement.desc: A ScopeReference shall reference an existing MobSlot or NestedScope track.

requirement.name: Effect Parameter Specification
requirement.desc: Effect parameters shall be specified using ConstantValue or VaryingValue objects.

requirement.name: Interpolation for Time-Varying Parameters
requirement.desc: Interpolation between ControlPoints within VaryingValue objects shall be specified as one of the following: ConstantInterpolator, LinearInterpolator, LogInterpolator, PowerInterpolator, BSplineInterpolator.

requirement.name: Importing Effect Interpolation Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support the required interpolation, it may fallback to linear interpolation. This fallback behaviour shall be logged.

requirement.name: Importing Time-Varying Effect Parameter Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support time-varrying parameters, it may fallback to applying an average of the ControlPoint values. This fallback behaviour shall be logged.

requirement.name: 2D Effect Parameter Normalization
requirement.desc: Effects that take multiple video inputs shall have all of their parameters VH normalized to the first video input unless explicitly stated otherwise in the effect definition.

requirement.name: Video Dissolve Specification
requirement.desc: A dissolve between overlapping video clips shall be specified using the Video Dissolve effect.

requirement.name: Video Dissolve Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Video Dissolve effect shall be used by an OperationGroup within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Video Dissolve Effects
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports video dissolves shall accept and present the Video Dissolve effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.2 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Video Wipe Specification
requirement.desc: Video Wipe effects that are defined within SMPTE 258 shall be specified using the SMPTE Video Wipe effect.

requirement.name: Video Wipe Effect Use
requirement.desc: The SMPTE Video Wipe effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Video Wipe Effects
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports video wipes defined within SMPTE 258M shall accept and present the SMPTE Video Wipe effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Video Speed Control Effect Specification
requirement.desc: A video speed control effect, describing alterations to the playback speed of a clip including forwards and backwards directions, shall be specified using a Video Speed Control effect.

requirement.name: Video Speed Control Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Video Speed Control effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained withing a Transition object.

requirement.name: Video Speed Control Effect - Speed Ratio Parameter Definition
requirement.desc: A ratio value of 0 shall not be used for the Speed Ratio paremeter of a Video Speed Control effect.

requirement.name: Importing Video Speed Control Effects
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports video speed control effects shall accept and present the Video Speed Control effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Video Repeat Effect Specification
requirement.desc: A video frame repeat effect, describing a clip that has a single essence frame as their original source, shall be specified using a Video Repeat effect.

requirement.name: Video Repeat Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Video Repeat effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Deprecated Video Repeat Effect Definition
requirement.desc: The Edit Protocol deprecates the use of specifying a Video Repeat Effect by using a SourceClip in a TimelineMobSlot that references a still frame in a StaticMobSlot. An exporting application shall not use this representation and an importing application need not accept it.

requirement.name: Importing Video Repeat Effects
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports video repeat effects shall accept and present the Video Repeat effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.2 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Video Flip Effect Specification
requirement.desc: A video flip effect shall be specified using the Video Flip effect.

requirement.name: Video Flip Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Video Flip effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Video Flip Effects
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports video flip effects shall accept and present the Video Flip effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Video Flop Effect Specification
requirement.desc: A video flop effect shall be specified using the Video Flop effect.

requirement.name: Video Flop Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Video Flop effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Video Flop Effects
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports video flop effects shall accept and present the Video Flop effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Video Flip-Flop Effect Specification
requirement.desc: A video flip-flop effect shall be specified using the Video Flip-Flop effect.

requirement.name: Video Flip-Flop Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Video Flip-Flop effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Video Flip-Flop Effects
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports video flip-flop effects shall accept and present the Video Flip-Flop effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Image Move Specification
requirement.desc: An image move shall be specified using the Video Position effect.

requirement.name: Video Position Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Video Position effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Image Positioning
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports image positioning shall accept and present the Video Position effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Image Crop Specification
requirement.desc: An image crop shall be specified using the Video Crop effect.

requirement.name: Video Crop Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Video Crop Effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Image Cropping
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports image cropping shall accept and present the Video Crop effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Image Scaling Specification
requirement.desc: Image scaling shall be specified using the Video Scale effect.

requirement.name: Video Scale Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Video Scale effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Image Scaling
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports image scaling shall accept and present the Video Scale effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Image Rotation Specification
requirement.desc: Image rotation shall be specified using the Video Rotate effect.

requirement.name: Video Rotate Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Video Rotate effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Image Rotation
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports image rotation shall accept and present the Video Rotate effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Image Corner Pinning Specification
requirement.desc: Image corner pinning shall be specified using the Video Corner Pinning effect.

requirement.name: Video Corner Pinning Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Video Corner Pinning effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Image Corner Pinning
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports image corner pinning shall accept and present the Video Corner Pinning effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Alpha Key Effect - Alpha Channel Withing Foreground Specification
requirement.desc: An alpha key effect in which the alpha channel is within the foreground video essence shall be specified using the Alpha With Video Key effect.

requirement.name: Alpha With Video Key Effect Specification
requirement.desc: In an Alpha With Video Key effect the alpha channel shall be contained within a channel of the foreground video essence, using either RGBA or YUVA. The essence descriptor shall be an RGBADescriptor object (or a sub-class) for RGBA, or a CDCIDescriptor object (or a sub-class) for CDCI. The alpha channel shall be indicated by the essence descriptor.

requirement.name: Alpha With Video Key Effect Properties
requirement.desc: In an Alpha With Video Key effect the DigitalImageDescriptor::AlphaTransparency property shall be present and specify whether the minimum Alpha value or the maximum Alpha value indicates complete transparency. The ParameterDef_AlphaKeyInvertAlpha parameter indicates wheter the transparency indicated by the DigitalImageDescriptor::AlphaTransparency property should be inverted.

requirement.name: Alpha With Video Key Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Alpha With Video Key effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Alpha Keying - Alpha With Video Key
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports alpha keying shall accept and present the Alpha With Video Key effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Alpha Key Effect - Alpha Channel Essence Separate
requirement.desc: An alpha key effect in which the alpha channel essence is separate from the video foreground and background essence shall be specified using the Separate-Alpha Key effect.

requirement.name: Separate-Alpha Key Effect Specification
requirement.desc: In a Separate-Alpha Key effect the alpha channel shall be contained within a channel of separate essence, using either RGBA or YUVA. The essence descriptor shall be an RGBADescriptor object (or a sub-class) for RGBA, or a CDCIDescriptor object (or a sub-class) for CDCI. Where the alpha channel is indicated by the essence descriptor, the channel shall be used as the alpha channel. Where the alpha channel is not indicated by the essence descriptor, the luminance value of essence shall be used as the alpha channel.

requirement.name: Separate-Alpha Key Effect Properties
requirement.desc: In a Separate-Alpha Key effect the DigitalImageDescriptor::AlphaTransparency property shall be present and specify whether the minimum Alpha value or the maximum Alpha value indicates complete transparency. The ParameterDef_AlphaKeyInvertAlpha parameter indicates whether the transparency indicated by the DigitalImageDescriptor::AlphaTransparency property should be inverted.

requirement.name: Separate-Alpha Key Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Separate Alpha Key effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Alpha Keying - Separate-Alpha Key
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports alpha keying shall accept and present the Separate Alpha Key effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Luminance Key Effect Specification
requirement.desc: A luminance key effect shall be specified using the Luminance Key effect. The luminance is determined from the Y or the RGB channels.

requirement.name: Luminance Key Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Luminance Key effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Luminance Keying
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports luminance keying shall accept and present the Luminance Key effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Chroma Key Effect Specification
requirement.desc: A chroma key effect shall be specified using the Chroma Key effect.

requirement.name: Chroma Key Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Chroma Key effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Chroma Keying
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports chroma keying shall accept and present the Chroma Key effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Audio Gain Effect Specification
requirement.desc: An audio gain effect, specifying how the level of an audio signal is amplified or attenuated over time, shall be specified using the Mono Audio Gain effect.

requirement.name: Mono Audio Gain Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Mono Audio Gain effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Serializing Audio Gain
requirement.desc: Both clip and track gain may apply to a clip. The resulting gain shall be calculated as follows: 1. Multiply each audio sample by the clip gain amplitude multiplier (if any specified); 2. Multiply the resulting value by the track gain amplitude multiplier (if any is specified); 3. Apply the appropriate saturation (clipping) algorithm to the result computed in step 2.

requirement.name: Importing Audio Gain
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports audio gain effects shall accept and present the Mono Audio Gain effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Audio Pan Effect Specification
requirement.desc: An audio pan effect, specifying the left/right balance of mono audio sources in a streo sound field, shall be specified using the Mono Audio Pan effect.

requirement.name: Mono Audio Pan Effect Application
requirement.desc: A Mono Audio Pan effect shall only be applied to audio tracks that refer to mono essence.

requirement.name: Audio Pan Effect Nesting
requirement.desc: Audio pan effects shall not be nested. The top-level pan value shall be applied.

requirement.name: Mono Audio Pan Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Mono Audio Pan effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup not contained within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Track-Based Pan
requirement.desc: Pan automation shall be track-based. If an application has a differnt native representation, it shall convert to and from its native representation when exporting and importing the composition.

requirement.name: Importing Audio Pan Effects
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports audio pan effects shall accept and present the Mono Audio Pan effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Single-Parameter Audio Dissolve Effect Specification
requirement.desc: A dissolve between overlapping audio clips in which the fade out of the outgoing "A" segment is the mirror image in time of the fade in of the incoming "B" segment, shall be specified using the Single-Parameter Mono Audio Dissolve effect.

requirement.name: Single-Parameter Mono Audio Dissolve Effect Use
requirement.desc: The Single-Parameter Mono Audio Dissolve effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Importing Single-Parameter Audio Dissolve Effects
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports audio dissolves, in which the fade out of the outgoing "A" segment is the mirror image in time of the fade in of the incoming "B" segment, shall accept and present the Single-Parameter Mono Audio Dissolve effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Two-Parameter Audio Dissolve Effect Specification
requirement.desc: A dissolve between overlapping audio clips, in which the levels of incoming "B" segment and outgoing "A" segment are independently defined, shall be specified using the Two-Parameter Mono Audio Dissolve effect.

requirement.name: Two-Parameter Mono Audio Dissolve Use
requirement.desc: The Two-Parameter Mono Audio Dissolve effect shall only be used by an OperationGroup within a Transition object.

requirement.name: Complete Specification of Incoming Segment Needed for Audio Dissolve
requirement.desc: In a Two-Parameter Mono Audio Dissolve effect, although the incoming segment is first faded up only at a point X, the incoming segment must be specified from the begining of the Transition.

requirement.name: Complete Specification of Both Segments Needed for Audio Dissolve
requirement.desc: In a Two-Parameter Mono Audio Dissolve effect, although the incomming segment is first faded up only at a point X, the incoming segment must be specified from the beginning of the Transition. Similarily, although the outgoing segment is completely faded down at point Y, the outgoing segment must be specified to the end of the Transition.

requirement.name: Importing Two-Parameter Audio Dissolve with Non-Existant Reference
requirement.desc: If the SourceClip objects in a Two-Parameter Audio Dissolve effect reference non-existant material, an importing application shall treat this as a reference to Filler, and present as black picture or silent audio.

requirement.name: Importing Two-Parameter Audio Dissolve Effects
requirement.desc: An importing application that supports audio dissolves, in which the levels of the incoming "B" segment and outgoing "A" segment are independently specified, shall accept and present the Two-Parameter Mono Audio Dissolve effect, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol.

requirement.name: Importing Two-Parameter Audio Dissolve Effect Fallback Behaviour
requirement.desc: If the importing application does not support audio dissolves, in which the levels of the incoming "B" segment and the outgoing "A" segment are independently specified, then it shall fallback to a dissolve in which the level of the incoming "B" segment is the complement of the level of the outgoing "A" segment, following the precepts of Section 4.2.4 of the AAF Edit Protocol. This fallback shall be logged.

requirement.name: Exporting Optional Properties
requirement.desc: When the value of an optional property is unknown, the exporting application shall omit that property.

requirement.name: Structured Storage File Encoding
requirement.desc: For Structured Storage encoding of the AAF file, the exporting application shall use a sector size of 4096 bytes. An importing application shall accept sector sizes of 512 or 4096 bytes.

requirement.name: Protocol Label
requirement.desc: Header::OperationalPattern should be equal to OpEditProtocol.
